abstract.text: A constant that specifies how the layer’s contents are positioned or scaled within its bounds.

The default value of this property is
The naming of contents gravity constants is based on the direction of the vertical axis.  If you are using gravity constants with a vertical component, e.g.
, you should also check the layer’s
aligns contents to the bottom of the layer and
aligns content to the top of the layer.

The default coordinate system for views in macOS and iOS differ in the orientation of the vertical axis: in macOS, the default coordinate system has its origin at the lower left of the drawing area and positive values extend up from it, and in iOS the default coordinate system has its origin at the upper left of the drawing area and positive values extend down from it.

abstract.text: A true value.
Render, compose, and animate visual elements.
An object that manages image-based content and allows you to perform animations on that content.
The background color of the receiver. Animatable.
The color of the layer’s border. Animatable.
The width of the layer’s border. Animatable.
Returns a Boolean indicating whether the layer content is implicitly flipped when rendered.
A constant that specifies how the layer’s contents are positioned or scaled within its bounds.
The radius to use when drawing rounded corners for the layer’s background. Animatable.
A Boolean indicating whether the layer displays its content when facing away from the viewer. Animatable.
A Boolean indicating whether the layer is displayed. Animatable.
An optional layer whose alpha channel is used to mask the layer’s content.
A Boolean indicating whether sublayers are clipped to the layer’s bounds. Animatable.
The opacity of the receiver. Animatable.
The offset (in points) of the layer’s shadow. Animatable.
The opacity of the layer’s shadow. Animatable.
The blur radius (in points) used to render the layer’s shadow. Animatable.
The content is horizontally centered at the bottom-edge of the bounds rectangle.
The content is positioned in the bottom-left corner of the bounds rectangle.
The content is horizontally and vertically centered in the bounds rectangle.
The content is resized to fit the entire bounds rectangle.
The content is horizontally centered at the top-edge of the bounds rectangle.
The content is positioned in the top-left corner of the bounds rectangle.
The contents gravity constants specify the position of the content object when the layer bounds is larger than the bounds of the content object. They are used by the
property.
